alert.note: Alert for Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 8:14AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Grady, northwestern Cleveland and northwestern McClain Counties through 845 AM CDT... At 814 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bridge Creek, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Oklahoma City, southwestern Norman, Moore, Newcastle, Blanchard, Noble, Tuttle, Goldsby, Bridge Creek and Middleberg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 104 and 120. Interstate 44 between mile markers 90 and 112. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
